author: wsjcom
title: Five Best: Laura Thompson
text:
Miss Pym Disposes By Josephine Tey (1946)
1 . In ‘Miss Pym Disposes,’ young women find fulfillment at Leys, an elite physical-education college. One could call the novel Sapphic, with its loving descriptions of goddess-like girls—golden Pamela Nash, enigmatic Mary Innes—and the gymnastic exercises (which will later kill one of them) that display “muscles rippling in the light.” Yet the tone is seriously innocent. The college is described with a devout absorption that casts the same pure spell as the school stories of one’s...
